metadata.title: CVE-2024-42315 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:exfat: fix potential deadlock on __exfat_get_dentry_setWhen accessing a file with more entries than ES_MAX_ENTRY_NUM, the bh-arrayis allocated in __exfat_get_entry_set. The problem is that the bh-array isallocated with GFP_KERNEL. It does not make sense. In the following cases,a deadlock for sbi->s_lock between the two processes may occur.       CPU0                CPU1       ----                ----  kswapd   balance_pgdat    lock(fs_reclaim)                      exfat_iterate                       lock(&sbi->s_lock)                       exfat_readdir                        exfat_get_uniname_from_ext_entry                         exfat_get_dentry_set                          __exfat_get_dentry_set                           kmalloc_array                            ...                            lock(fs_reclaim)    ...    evict     exfat_evict_inode      lock(&sbi->s_lock)To fix this, let's allocate bh-array with GFP_NOFS.
